intro: Senecio guatulamensis, commonly known as the Guatulamense groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters. Senecio guatulamensis is often found in high-altitude regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
